question_sentence: Whom did the US government dispatch to the Middle East to try and secure a last-ditch Gaza ceasefire deal?
evidence: It was the Secretary of State's ninth visit to the Middle East since the conflict began, with this round of talks focussing on a "bridging agreement" which would secure a ceasefire and allow for the release of Israeli hostages in Hamas captivity.

question_sentence: A Confederate monument in Decatur, Georgia, was replaced with a statue of which civil rights leader?
evidence: Workers installed a 12ft bronze statue of John Lewis in front of the DeKalb County Courthouse, formerly the site of a 30ft obelisk erected in memory of the Confederate cause in 1908. The statue of the civil rights hero will be officially unveiled on 24 August.

question_sentence: Which country has retained the dubious title of having the highest number of drug deaths in Europe?
evidence: Figures published by the National Records of Scotland showed that there were 1,172 drug misuse deaths in 2023, an increase on the year before. Of those, 80% involved opiates or opioids such as heroin, morphine and methadone.

question_sentence: The deadlier Clade 1b variant of mpox has reached Asia, after a case was confirmed in which country?
evidence: Thai authorities said the patient was a 66-year-old European man who had recently been in an African country experiencing an mpox outbreak before arriving in Bangkok on 14 August. He is being treated in hospital after exhibiting symptoms of the virus.

question_sentence: Which A-list couple has filed for divorce on the anniversary of their wedding celebration?
choices: Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith
evidence: It has been a bumpy road to say the least for the couple, who first dated in 2003 before separating, marrying other people, divorcing them, and then finally reuniting in 2021 in what was termed "Bennifer 2.0". However, after two years of marriage, the pair are once again calling it quits.

question_sentence: Brian Niccol was the CEO and chair of which fast-food chain before becoming the new CEO of Starbucks?
evidence: Brian Niccol will replace Laxman Narasimhan, who has served as Starbucks' CEO starting in 2023. Niccol has been the CEO and chair of Mexican fast-food chain Chipotle since 2018.

question_sentence: Which publishing giant has signed a deal with OpenAI to share content from its magazines with the AI platform?
evidence: Under the terms of the deal, OpenAI will be licensed to use content from the publisher's brands, which include Vogue, GQ and The New Yorker. Condé Nast is the latest in a series of firms to sign deals with AI platforms in an attempt to secure attribution and revenue sharing, and protect against unauthorised use by rival AI companies.

question_sentence: After giving an emotional speech at the Democratic National Convention, Joe Biden left for a family vacation in which state?
evidence: Biden left the convention for a family vacation in California, and after he "lays low for the rest of the month, the president and his senior advisers have fixated on the finishing touches of his career", Politico said.

question_sentence: Which British private school has come under fire for plans to open a new franchise in China?
evidence: Harrow's new campus in Guangzhou will be its ninth Chinese outpost, but the first since President Xi's education reforms emphasising a "patriotic" curriculum – prompting accusations in the British media that public schools are selling out.

question_sentence: The second-largest diamond ever unearthed has been found in which African country?
evidence: The 2,492-carat gem was found in the Canadian-owned Karowe mine. The diamond trade is key to Botswana's economy, accounting for roughly 25% of the country's GDP.

question_sentence: Thousands of delegates and supporters flocked to the Democratic National Convention this week in which city?
evidence: The energy was high at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where public figures and musicians delivered back-to-back speeches and performances throughout the week.

question_sentence: Italian authorities launched a search for missing people after a superyacht sank off the coast of Sicily this week. Why did the boat capsize?
evidence: A tornado sank the superyacht, officials said. Video shows the boat being battered by the storm and rocking violently moments before capsizing.

question_sentence: Which astronomical event created a stellar sight for millions worldwide?
evidence: A super blue moon — a rare cosmic combination of a supermoon and a blue moon — could be seen in the sky on Monday.

question_sentence: How much is a gold bar worth in the US?
evidence: An average gold bar — which weighs 400 troy ounces — is now worth $1 million. The price of gold has risen as central banks and investors see the precious metal as a long-term, reliable store of value.

question_sentence: According to the FBI, which country is behind hacking attempts targeting the Trump and Biden-Harris campaigns?
evidence: The US government has concluded that the Iranian government is behind the hack and leak operation that targeted Donald Trump's presidential campaign and also attempted to target the Biden-Harris campaign.

question_sentence: Which company is set to attempt the first spacewalk carried out by private citizens?
evidence: SpaceX's Polaris Dawn mission will carry four people with no prior spaceflight experience on a risky journey into the radiation belt.

question_sentence: Which state was drenched by unprecedented flooding this week?
evidence: The governor of Connecticut declared a state of emergency on Monday after historic flooding left at least two dead and prompted hundreds of evacuations.

question_sentence: Roughly how many babies were born in the US last year?
evidence: Approximately 3.6 million babies were born in the US in 2023 — about 68,000 fewer than the year before. Women in the US are having babies less often for various social and economic reasons, including barriers in some states that limit access to reproductive care.

question_sentence: Which airline plans to buy Hawaiian Airlines in a $1.9 billion deal?
evidence: The anticipated merger of Alaska Airlines and Hawaiian Airlines will “vastly expand the number of destinations throughout North America for Hawaii residents that can be reached nonstop or one-stop from the islands," Hawaii's Gov. Josh Green said this week.

question_sentence: Which celebrity couple called it quits this week?
evidence: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are officially parting ways, according to an entry on the Los Angeles Superior Court docket. The breakup comes after reports the two had been living separately, Lopez canceled her summer tour to spend time with her family, and they put their Beverly Hills home on the market.

question_sentence: Why did Wyndham Garden hotel initially claim the reservations for Phish fans were canceled?
choices: Because the hotel had been overbooked due to a mistake in their reservation system
Because the hotel was being renovated and needed to close rooms for maintenance.
Because the hotel was under a special contract to host local sports teams that weekend.

question_sentence: What was the main reason Delaware Animal Services intervened at the Bridgeville-area home?
choices: The homeowners were suspected of running an illegal dog breeding operation.
An anonymous tip reported poor conditions and neglect of the dogs at the property.
The homeowners had failed to pay for their dog licenses and fines.

question_sentence: Why did the five juveniles confront the three women in Rehoboth Beach, according to the police?
choices: They believed the women were violating local curfew laws.
They were acting based on their perception of the women's sexual orientation.
They thought the women had damaged their car.

question_sentence: According to the DatingNews.com survey, which state was found to have the highest frequency of mind games in online dating?
Which University of Delaware football player is expected to take on a larger role at inside linebacker for the upcoming season?
What was Lori Fanning Hatton sentenced to for stealing nearly $29,000 from an elderly couple?
Which collectible item is NOT mentioned as being available at Cinemark locations in Delaware?
Which statistic did Ryan O’Connor NOT achieve during the 2023 season?
choices: 70% completion rate in a game against Duquesne
336 passing yards and three touchdowns in a game against New Hampshire
2,104 passing yards over the entire season

question_sentence: What is one key change introduced by the new real estate rules starting August 17?
choices: Sellers are now required to pay the commissions for both the buyer’s and the seller’s agents.
Sellers are no longer required to compensate buyer agents, and buyers must sign contracts to set agent compensation.
The National Association of Realtors will set fixed commission rates for all transactions.
